title: ACH Food Companies Recalls Beehive Corn Syrup Over Potential Health Risk
text: ACH Food Companies, Inc. has issued a recall of Beehive brand corn syrup due to the possible presence of hazardous foreign objects.  The recall affects 55-gallon containers of syrup distributed in British Columbia.  The potentially contaminated products are identified by the code 220D4 and UPC 000-76172-019121.  Consumers who have purchased these items are urged to return them to the place of purchase for a full refund.  The recall was triggered by reports of plastic fragments in some containers. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is investigating the cause of the contamination and working with ACH Food Companies to ensure a complete resolution.  No injuries have been reported.  Further details can be obtained by contacting the CFIA's consumer hotline.

title: Sunflower Oil Recall Due to PAH Contamination
text:
A recent investigation by the Centre for Food Safety (CFS) has identified potentially hazardous levels of Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAHs), specifically benzo[a]pyrene (BaP), in several sunflower oil brands.  The affected products, sourced from Italy and France, have been identified as potentially unsafe for consumption due to exceeding established safety standards.  

Three brands were found to be compromised: 'goccia d'oro', 'Bio Planete', and 'Da Agricoltura'.  'Goccia d'oro' sunflower oil contained 13 µg/kg BaP, exceeding the CFS's 10 µg/kg action level.  'Bio Planete' and 'Da Agricoltura' showed 22 µg/kg and 26 µg/kg respectively. The results prompted the CFS to issue a recall.  

All vendors and distributors of the affected batches are instructed to cease sales and remove the products from shelves immediately. Retailers are urged to check stock and act accordingly to protect consumer health. Consumers are advised to refrain from consuming any of the listed products, as continued consumption may pose health risks.  Detailed lot numbers and product descriptions are listed below:

(1) goccia d'oro Sunflower Oil, Lot L.001793, 1 litre bottles, best-before date January 31, 2017
(2) Bio Planete Organic Sunflower Oil virgin, Lot 49370033 EP, 500 ml bottles, best-before date May 31, 2017
(3) Da Agricoltura Organic Sunflower Seed Oil, Lot L04216, 750 ml bottles, best-before date August 11, 2017

The CFS is actively investigating the source of contamination and will provide further updates as they become available.

title: Mount Majura Vineyard - 2010 Wine Recall - Potential Explosion Risk
text:
Incident Report: 2023-10-27

Reference: MMV-2010-001

Product: 2010 Vino Cotto, 250ml glass bottles

Description:  2010 vintage wine, bottled in a glass container for consumption.

Hazard: Potential for spontaneous bottle explosion due to unforeseen internal pressure buildup.

Affected Batch(es): All bottles of 2010 Vino Cotto produced between April 22, 2010 and November 28, 2010.

Symptoms:  Potential for the bottle cap to violently detach upon opening, or, in extreme cases, spontaneous fragmentation of the glass container.

Affected Locations: Mount Majura Vineyard Cellar Door, and customers who ordered via mail.

Recommendations: Consumers should immediately cease use of affected bottles. Follow the below guidelines to safely dispose of the product.  Contact Mount Majura Vineyard for a full refund at (02) 6262 3070.

Disposal Instructions:
1. Place the bottle on a stable surface.
2. Wrap the bottle in multiple layers of absorbent material (e.g., towels, thick cloth). Securely wrap cap-end away from your body.
3. Slowly and cautiously open the bottle, permitting any internal pressure to release gradually.
4. Dispose of the contents and empty bottle per local waste management regulations.

Further Information:  Complete recall documentation is available on the Mount Majura Vineyard website.

Responsible Authority: Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC).

The facility is unregistered and does not adhere to EU food safety and hygiene standards.  A key component, concentrated CBD, is deemed an unauthorized novel food, posing an unassessed health risk.  Consumption of any batch of Deus Gold Full Spectrum Hemp Oil is strongly discouraged.  This recall is effective immediately. Consumers with affected product should return it to the point of purchase for a full refund.

title: Recall of 'MuscleMax' Testosterone Booster Due to Undeclared Steroid Contamination
text: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE – San Francisco, California.  MuscleMax, a dietary supplement marketed as a testosterone booster, is being recalled voluntarily by its manufacturer, Apex Nutrition, due to potential contamination with an undeclared anabolic steroid. title: Recall Notice: Possible Bromate Contamination in Imported Soda Water
text: A recall is being initiated for a specific batch of imported soda water, potentially contaminated with elevated levels of bromate.  The affected product, Chang brand soda water, imported by Best Spirits Co. Ltd. from Cosmos Brewery (Thailand), is 325 milliliters per bottle and has a best-before date of January 23, 2021. The hazard is linked to a possible excess of bromate, an ionic form of bromic acid, exceeding safety standards in Macau and discovered in a batch re-exported from Hong Kong.  This batch was imported in 2,800 cartons, with some distributed in Hong Kong and a portion re-exported to Macau.  Ingestion of high quantities of bromate can cause gastrointestinal distress, and potentially more serious kidney and nervous system issues.  While animal studies link bromate to potential cancer risk, human studies are insufficient to confirm this risk.  The Centre for Food Safety (CFS) has issued this alert and contacted importers and retailers for immediate action.  Best Spirits Co. Ltd. is undertaking a product recall, and consumers should contact their hotline at 2378 2563 or 2378 2561 for further inquiries.  All trade partners possessing the product should immediately discontinue sales and distribution. Further investigation is underway and compliance with public health regulations is strongly advised.  Penalties for non-compliance are substantial, as defined in Section 54 of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance.

text: Eugene, OR – March 12, 2009 – Euphoria Chocolate Company is voluntarily recalling certain peanut clusters due to a potential Salmonella contamination risk.  This recall follows a broader recall of peanut products from Peanut Corporation of America.  The company is taking this precautionary measure, despite the absence of any reported illnesses associated with their products.  Affected clusters, sold through specialty stores and Euphoria Chocolate Company locations in Oregon and Washington, include milk and dark chocolate peanut clusters.  These products were distributed between January 1, 2007 and January 22, 2009, with a 'Best If Used By' date of February 12, 2009 or earlier.  Consumers can identify the recalled items by specific UPC codes printed on the packaging.  Consumers are urged to return any affected product to participating Euphoria Chocolate Company stores. A complete list of stores and the recall details, including UPC codes, can be found on the company website.  Customers with questions can contact the company's customer service line between 8:30 am and 2:00 pm PST, Monday through Friday.

title: Europlus Halva Recall - Undeclared Pistachio
text: Europlus Pty Ltd is initiating a product recall for a batch of their Mahroum Sesame Halva, 400g, with a Best Before date of 31-Dec-2018.  This recall affects retailers throughout NSW, QLD, and VIC, including delicatessens, independent grocery stores, bakeries, IGAs and Foodworks. The reason for the recall is the presence of an undeclared pistachio nut allergen.  Consumers with a pistachio allergy should immediately avoid consuming this product and return it to the store of purchase for a full refund.  The product originates from Israel.  Contact Europlus Pty Ltd at 0412 358 593 for further information.

title: Target Australia Recall: Candy Cane Possible Plastic Contamination
text: Target Australia is initiating a voluntary recall of their Candy Cane 40g product due to a potential contamination concern.  The recall affects products with a best-before date of August 1, 2019, sold between September 16, 2018, and December 17, 2018, nationwide at Target and Target Country stores.  The product is suspected to contain plastic fragments, which poses a hazard of injury if ingested.  Consumers are urged not to consume any affected product and to return it to the point of purchase (Target or Target Country) for a full refund, without a receipt.  Further information and support are available via phone at 1300 753 567 or online at www.target.com.au/help/contact-us.  This recall is coordinated by Food Standards Australia New Zealand (FSANZ).  The product category is confectionery. Consumers who purchased the recalled item and have any concerns are advised to contact Target's customer support.

title: Plastic Fragments Found in Miniature Marzipan Treats - Recall Issued
text: A recall has been initiated for a specific batch of Anthon Berg Sweet Moments Marzipan Bars.  Consumers are advised to immediately discontinue consumption of the affected product due to a significant safety concern: foreign plastic fragments.  The affected product is the Anthon Berg Sweet Moments Marzipan Bar Mini, 165g, with UPC code 0 74540 90603 0.  This recall, issued by Concord Sales Ltd., targets products distributed in Ontario.  Consumers who have purchased this product are urged to contact the manufacturer or appropriate regulatory authorities for a full refund or return program.  This incident involves a class 3 hazard. This recall is not limited to a single product run, but encompasses all products with production dates up to October 9, 2018. This recall is related to an earlier recall of the Anthon Berg Cognac Marzipan Bar, issued on November 3, 2017.  Consumers should retain their purchase receipts. Further details, including a reference number (11909), are available on the CFIA website.

title: National Recall: Milk Chocolate-Covered Raisins - Potential Peanut Allergen
text: A nationwide recall is underway for milk chocolate-covered raisins due to a potential for peanut contamination.  Affected products were purchased from various retail locations including Coles, Bi-lo, Newmart, and Pick'n'Pay.  All batches are potentially affected.  Consumers who have purchased these products are urged to immediately return them to the place of purchase for a full refund.  For further information, please contact the customer service line at 1800 061 562.  This recall is coordinated by Food Standards Australia New Zealand.  Consumers with peanut allergies should exercise extreme caution.  This incident involves the hazard of peanut contamination in confectionery products.

title: Marshmallow Product Recall: Potential Milk Allergen Issue
text: October 26, 2023 - A recall has been initiated for certain Original Foods marshmallow products due to a possible undeclared milk allergen.  Consumers are urged to check their pantries for affected MallowBats and M'allows products.  The recall affects multiple sizes and UPC codes of the products.  Products with undisclosed milk content pose a risk to individuals with milk allergies.  Consumers are advised to discard or return any affected products to the point of purchase.  For detailed information regarding specific product codes and affected lots, please visit the Original Foods website or contact their customer service department.  This recall follows an investigation by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA), and further action or recalls may be possible.  For additional details and potential health concerns associated with this recall, please consult the relevant government agency advisories.

title: Recall of Gluten-Contaminated Bean Snack: Urgent Action Needed
text: A recall is being issued for a batch of bean snacks due to undeclared gluten content.  The affected product, a bean snack, is sold under the brand Simpleas and was produced by Novo Farina.  This product poses a serious risk to consumers with gluten sensitivities.  Specifically, the Simpleas Lightly Salted Pea Snack, pack size 23g, batch code 028 21, with a best-before date of January 28, 2022, has been identified as containing undeclared gluten.  Consumers who purchased this product are urged not to consume it and are instructed to return it to the store of purchase for a full refund.  Novo Farina has taken immediate action, including contacting relevant allergy support organizations and distributing point-of-sale notices to inform customers of the recall.  Detailed information regarding the recall, including the necessary steps to take, are available at the attached notice.  Consumers with concerns about gluten allergies should immediately cease consumption and return any affected products.  The Food Standards Agency (FSA) has issued an allergy alert (Ref: FSA-AA-38-2021) regarding this incident. This is a critical food safety alert.

title: PepsiCo Recalls Tortilla Chips Due to Undisclosed Dairy Ingredient
text: PepsiCo is recalling Tostitos Cantina Extra Thin Tortilla Chips due to an undeclared milk allergen.  The recall affects 220g bags of chips with specific UPC codes (505122506 or 505222506).  These products were distributed in Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, Northwest Territories, Ontario, and Saskatchewan.  Consumers with milk allergies should not consume the recalled chips.  Recalled products should be discarded or returned to the place of purchase.  No adverse health reactions have been reported to date.  The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is leading the investigation.  For further details or to report a problem, contact PepsiCo Foods Canada at 1-800-376-2257, or the CFIA directly.

title: Allfect Ltd Candy Recall - Potential Metal Contamination
text: Allfect Ltd is recalling a batch of their Lollipop candies, due to a potential for metal fragments.  Consumers who purchased the 4.5 gram lollipops should immediately stop consumption and return them to the retailer where they were purchased, for a full refund.  Food Standards Australia New Zealand (FSANZ) is overseeing the recall, with incident number 2023-10-27-001.  Affected products from the April 17, 1998 batch are potentially hazardous due to the presence of metal fragments.  Do not consume the product.  Contact your retailer for details or visit the FSANZ website for further information.
